esri_sdk_sample.title: Creating a toolbar of globe tools

purpose.div: This add-in sample shows how to write ArcObjects code to build a toolbar of tools that work in ArcGlobe, which allows you to interactively create three-dimensional (3D) points, rasterized polylines and polygons, and two-dimensional (2D) text by clicking the globe surface. This sample also shows how to work with globe graphic containers, text elements, polygon elements, polyline elements, and point elements, and how to programmatically adjust various display settings.

Color palette implementation. Displays dialog box allowing you to select red, green, and blue (RGB) color.
Color selection implementation. Static class used to persist selected color.
Geographic coordinates implementation. Converts from window to geographic coordinates and allows coordinates to be accessed as individual getters.
Layer implementation. Wrapper class for globe graphics layer, returning element count and allowing elements to be added, removed, and retrieved by index.
Point element implementation. Sets element properties for a marker element whose symbol is set to 2D or 3D.

how_to_use_steps.step: Click Customize, click Customize Mode, then click the Toolbars tab.
Select GraphicsToolbar on the Toolbars pane.
To use the Point tool, click the globe surface to digitize a 3D sphere.
To use the Polyline tool, click the globe surface to digitize the polyline vertices, and double-click to end the polyline.
To use the Polygon tool, click the globe surface to digitize the polygon vertices and double-click to close the polygon.
To use the Text tool, click the globe surface to specify where the text should be centered, type text on the dialog box that appears, and press Enter.
Selecting a custom color via the Color tool before using any of the previous tools, causes the color of the digitized geometry or text to change accordingly.
